name: The St. Regis Rome

reviews.title: Absolutely 5 Star Hotel
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through AMEX Fine Hotels & Resorts Program, and for the price of a standard room (not cheap) we were upgraded to a palatial room with beautiful art and amenities. The included breakfast was excellent, and the main "lobby" surroundings are remarkable. Check out the photos on the hotel's web site.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006
reviews.text: There is an excellent bar for drinks at the end of the day.
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Rome!

likes.disliked: — The prices of food and drinks and the not so good food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The front desk and concierge were as good or better than I've seen in any European city: friendly, helpful, courteous. The concierge and I discussed the dinner reservations I had made from home weeks earlier, and made some appropriate changes to better suit what we were looking for.
reviews.title: Grand hotel, but a little cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is not really within walking distance of much, but there's always a cab outside the door, and they are not badly priced in Rome (try London!).
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel but lacks something

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There were lots of dignitaries present (no idea of what country) and although we are nobody, we were treated as if we were members of royalty.
reviews.title: Very pleasant
Just Fab!
reviews.text: Real luxury! A honeymoon couldn't have such a lack in a city like rome.. we had our extraquality time and we stayed in this terrific hotel. Standards are very high, fully reflecting those 5 stars. Our room was not that large but still very elegant. Nice wellness at lower floor. Never tried to eat there we much enjoyed tratorias around. Rome is a unique place full of ruins and antiques. Surely a top place for honeymoon or shopping. Rome and St. Regis are highly reccomended to enjoy something really special.

reviews.title: Highlight of our honeymoon!
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here for the last three nights of our honeymoon in France and Italy. We stayed using cash 'n points ($150 + 8,000 starwood points a night, vs. 20,000 points or 500 euros) and were upgraded to a huge & amazing junior suite. No view (first floor facing inner courtyard) but a very elegant room with fantastic bathroom -- bigger than our whole room in Venice -- very comfortable bed (though amazingly, still two twins put together), two flat screen tvs and lots of elegant touches. Concierge also gave a great recommendation for a nearby dinner spot. He was less helpful when we sought out a group tour; they had recommendations for private tours but were pricier than we wanted. They've really thought of everything at this hotel: umbrellas when it's raining, friendly and professional but not imposing staff, amazing decor. My wife absolutely loved it and the room was so amazing that we didn't care that it rained nearly the entire time we were in Rome.

reviews.title: loved The St. Regis
reviews.text: A Fairy Tale Start to A Wonderful Vacation.

reviews.title: Amazing guestrooms
reviews.text: We arrived at !0:30am on Oct.12 for 4 nites before our cruise.I had e-mailed about an early arrival and they would have our room ready shorthy.

reviews.title: Great way to start the honeymoon
reviews.text: We sat in the lounge for 10 minutes and then were shown to our room which had been upgraded (We booked an award.cash & point stay through Starwood)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a fabulous Hotel! We stayed for five nights late May to early June and had a fabulous time. Our room was beautiful; large, clean, crisp linen and L'Occitane in the bathroom. Breakfast lovely and the coffee very good. We dined in the restaurant (Vivendo) and had a lovely meal with the kind of personal service you remember. Rome was an enchanting place, with a soul that is awe-inspiring. Our Roman guides were testimony to the history and the passion of the city, but
reviews.title: St Regis was a treasure

likes.liked: — Nicely appointed, marble, space, linen and service.

reviews.title: Nice stay, not too sure if it was worth it....
reviews.text: Rome can also be be confronting and to come home each night to our sanctuary (St Regis Grand) was both comforting and relaxing. We were new tourists to Rome and were not aware of taxi strikes, street begging and wanna-be thieves, but our Hotel concierge (Stefano) was a great help in our times of need and he went above and beyond his role to assist us whenever required.

reviews.title: Romance in Rome
reviews.text: We can categorically recommend this Hotel! It's proximity to the Central Rail Station is great if you are using the rail system, but not so great if you are walking everywhere. We did walk toward the end of our stay when we managed to secure our bearings and realise that Ancient Rome is actually fairly small. But I suggest you use taxi's as they are not expensive in Rome, about 14 Euro's will take you from one side to the other!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Enjoy Rome, it is delightful, and the St Regis Grand Hotel a real treasure in a MUST-SEE city of the world...I think everyone needs to enjoy Rome at least once in their life!!
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay

likes.liked: — Eating breakfast in the lobby each morning

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 3 nights here in March with my wife to get a wekend away from the kids (1st time in 10 years) so i decided to splash out for this stay.
reviews.title: fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is it. One of the best hotels we have ever stayed at (compared to 4 Seasons, Bellagio, etc). Truly amazing staff/waiters. Unbelievable rooms and lobby. Response time when we called for luggage, shoe shine, newspaper, etc was hard to believe. (as if they were waiting outside our room ).Check on-line for special rates, Try to get a deluxe room with an exterior view verus superior rooms. Only weakness is Concierge staff which were insincere and going through the motions.
reviews.title: You have to stay here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had high expectations for the St. Regis in Rome. The hotel is opulent and the staff very good. However, it is not the best location or the best room for such a high price. Our room was tiny, even by Rome standards. The bathroom was nice but not huge. I would probably not stay here again unless it was free! Overrated, for sure.
reviews.title: not worth the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived around 10am after an overnight flight from the states. Arranged transportation via the hotel concierge in advance, which turned out to be semi-economical and very, very convenient. Rooms weren't ready (didn't expect them to be), but the front desk attendant walked us to the bar, saw to it that we were served coffee, and then came back every 20-30 minutes for the next hour to make sure we were comfortable. Around 11:30, we were led to our room which was as shown on the website, elegant. The whole place is of another era, one of formal elegance. The bed was extremely comfortable, and with the heavy curtains drawn, the room was quiet and dark, which made it easy to take a nap and get adjusted to European time. Room service was outrageously expensive, but not unexpected given the caliber of the hotel. Service throughout was attentive, if a bit overly formal. The common areas of the hotel are beautifully restored, and immaculate.
reviews.title: Old world elegance and sophistication

likes.liked: — old world elegance, sophication and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's not an economical choice, but a fine one nonetheless.
reviews.title: Loved the St Regis Rome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I , along with my in laws, stayed 4 nights at the St Regis in June of 2007. In all respects, this is a great property and hotel, other than a less than ideal location for proximity to shopping ( which I was happy about). The hotel staff are top notch, and the service is superb. The rooms are nice ( especially for Europe) and the beds are great--nice and soft, again a treasure in Europe. The breakfast is fantastic and the servers are out of this world. We had a server make us a belini without our asking to prove he makes the best one in Italy, better than Harry's Bar in Venice , which it was !!
reviews.title: Luxurious Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008
reviews.text: When I booked this hotel, I didn't realize that this is the old Grand Hotel of Rome. The Grand Hotel was a stuffy, unfriendly, tired hotel. The St. Regis was incredibly friendly, elegant, fun and worth the money.
reviews.title: It doesn't get better than this

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we entered the hotel we were taken good care of. Check in was short and friendly. As we were taken to our room, our butler arrived and he explained all the details of the room, the fact that we could have free coffee brought to the room at any time, etc. Every day a bottle of wine, cookies, and pastries were brought to the room free of charge.
reviews.title: Excellent Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our bedrooms were enormous with ornate and high ceilings, beautiful rich carpet, lovely art on the walls and large, well appointed bathrooms.
reviews.title: Absolutely Lovely!

likes.disliked: — Absolutely No Complaints...You will not find many hotels quite like this one!

reviews.title: Very good but not the best experience
reviews.text: The public areas of the hotel are the grandest that we have seen in any hotel. Breakfast was included and it had everything including a cook to prepare any kind of omelette, eggs, pancakes, etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife told me that the gym was nice but nothing extraordinary. The concierge staff were uniformly excellent and friendly. Our favorite trattoria was Costanza underneath Pompey's villa.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable
A little disappointed
reviews.text: yes the lobby is grand but all in all i was a little disappointed in the hotel. our room i thought was quite small with a boring courtyard view. i stayed in the westin excelsior on my last trip and thought the rooms were larger and nicer. the excelsior also has a pool and turkish steam room in the basement which is nice after a day of touring.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We rented a villa in Umbria for a week, and before returning home spent 3 nights at the St. Regis in Rome. Our stay was exceptional in every way. I travel relatively frequently for business, and can honestly say that I have never stayed in a more luxurious hotel.
reviews.title: Exceptional stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The St. Regis is sumptuously decorated, but compared to US hotels of this caliber the rooms are on the small size and thus there are no rooms with 2 queen beds. Accordingly, we had to book 2 rooms for our family of 4 (thus making an already expensive hotel 2x the price). Given the ages of our children, it was important to me that the rooms be connected -- when Starwood central reservations said they could not guarantee the rooms would be adjoining, I contacted the hotel directly who arranged for adjoining rooms.
reviews.title: Loved, the hotel, only like the location

likes.liked: — How elegant it was and the breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was above and beyond. We arrived by rental car on Saturday afternoon. I had been told by the rental car company that their offices closed at noon on Saturday and we would not be able to return the car until Sunday morning. So when we arrived at the hotel, I fully expected to pay for overnight parking and then dealing with the rental return the next day. Instead, when I pulled up to the front door, the bellman noticed that we had a rental car, and told us that he thought he would be able to arrange with the rental car company to come pick up the car from the hotel that afternoon, thereby saving us the overnight parking fees that the hassle of the return. 30 minutes later we received a call in our room informing us that Hertz was there to get our car.
reviews.title: St. Regis Upscale and Exclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is that the cost of breakfast was ridiculously high. While I expect the hotel to charge a premium for eating in the hotel, their buffet at EUR 47 per person was about 10x what we spent on breakfast out of the house.
reviews.title: Luxury stay at the St. Regis
Ok but could and should do better
reviews.text: The good things are that the St Regis is in a good location, central and convenient for sight seeing (although beware the area near the central train terminal at night, a 5min walk away). The staff were efficient although I wouldnt call them friendly. Furthermore I was a bit annoyed as I got charged an extra 25% per night because we were 2 people (my reservation was for 1). I didn't make a fuss over it but I cant understand how having a 2nd person in the room made any difference, apart from giving them a chance to make more money. We didn't have any breakfast or eat in the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was reasonably spacious and comfortable, although the decoration was bordering on the kitch. My main complaint would be the bathroom, as someone else has mentioned in their review the toilet often ran and this was noisy. Additionally the bathroom stank (faint sewer smell). The smell must have been coming from the pipes or the ventilation I am not sure but we were there for 4 nights and it smelled all the time. We had to keep the bathroom door closed at all times otherwise it would also stink out the room. Not what you would expect from a 5* hotel which was not cheap by any means. If I was in Rome again I would try a different hotel to this
reviews.title: Great hotel, some annoyances.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in May and was very pleased, however for a 5-star hotel that exudes pomp, I expected a little more. I have stayed at other luxury chains similar to the St. Regis, and don't feel this hotel met expectations. The rooms were fantastic, had a very comfortable bed and nice bathroom. However, housekeeping never restocked our toilet paper, we always had to call down for more. The toilet also ran, which was annoying. Normally, these things wouldn't irk me, but at a super-expensive, "5-star" hotel, this should not be an issue. The food at the restaurant is ok, but overpriced. Service at the restaurant was also fair, had to wait a while for a check. Just a note, I was with a group and we had 3 rooms, and they were all different in size and layout. This hotel was definitely nice, but I would stay in a different location at a smaller, less expensive hotel next time in Rome.
reviews.title: A Grand Hotel
Perfection
reviews.text: The St. Regis is a "grand hotel" and we found it an outstanding place to stay in Rome. Our room looked over the inner courtyard so it was very quiet. The room size was quite large for Europe and the bed was extremely comfortable. The fitness room and broadband internet are both very good. The staff was also very helpful. We had dinner at Vivendo in the hotel, and the food was outstanding and the wine list perhaps the best I have encountered in Italy. The restaurant staff is outstanding and the sommelier was very interesting and helpful. The hotel is about a 5 minute jog (or 10 minute walk) from the Villa Borghese which is among the most beuatiful places to jog in the world in the early morning. Our experience compared well with the grand hotels of Paris, which is high praise.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Everything was excellent. Nice staff, perfect concierge service and delightfull breakfast every morning. Feel like coming home after a day of adventure. We had the imperial room which is worth the money compared to a standard room. We had a butler that treated us with little snacks every day. One of the best in the world!
reviews.title: A truly wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Overall I was very impressed by the level of service and the friendliness of the staff - there was none of the attitude one can encounter in Italy.
reviews.title: Very good experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008
reviews.text: Check-in was extremely courteous and helpful. I had booked a standard room and forgot to specify twin beds, but the staff member immediately offered to switch us to a twin-bedded room and give us an upgrade to deluxe. As the room was not ready yet, we were treated to a complimentary drink whilst we waited (only 20 minutes or so).
reviews.title: Not the best, but pretty good!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The public areas are very grand and impressive and beautifully kept. The room was also nice and spacious, for my taste perhaps a bit over the top with the murals.
reviews.title: Outstanding Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Again very friendly staff at the breakfast buffet, whom I observed dealing with rather difficult guests gracefully and patiently. As we are not big breakfast eaters, we were not billed the full rate on a couple of occasions, which is a nice gesture.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is a mixed blessing. It is not in a lively or elegant area of town, but then it is still pretty central and convenient for the main railway station, numerous buses and the metro.
reviews.title: Superb

aka: The St. Regis Rome Hotel Rome
description: Caesar Ritz proudly opened "The Grand" in 1894 as Rome's first luxury hotel and today it still maintains the prestigious status to be one of the world's finest hotels. Each guest room or suite features a unique identity and is exquisitely appointed in a combination of Empire, Regency and Louis XV styles. Complimentary Wi-Fi Internet access is available in the hotel lobby, at Le Grand Bar and at Vivendo Restaurant.
